ratings.comment: Took 506 in spring 2025 and has been the best CS class I have taken in terms of practically preparing you for industry. Topics are the basis of being a SWE and the group project allows you to get experience dealing with real issues. I've never been once bored in a lecture and is by far the most engaging cs professor I have had.

This class is supposed to simulate a SWE work environment, but the only thing it prepares you for is dealing with a narcissistic man with a short fuse. He acts like an awful boss, not your professor. I'm genuinely concerned on how he is still allowed to teach after all of these bad reviews and many complaints to the department. Do better Madison.

Awful. Class in itself isn't hard, it's mostly there to teach working in a SWE team. However, Swanson is not likable and very full of himself as a person; which is a shame given that there are interesting ideas in the material. Reading quizzes grading and course logistics are a pain. Took it with 5 other advanced ECE courses and 506 was my busiest.

crashed a discussion section and began to tell everyone how hard he had it in school and passively aggressively yelled for 1hour for students not being focused, then began to randomly pick people to the front of the class to solve problems. The TA's were shocked. I learned that day why he has such bad ratings. He's like the grinch!
Why is he so angry? One of the most rude professors i've ever had...

Scott must dislike his life the way he is so angry all the time. Get some help Scott, you make the world a toxic place. Really unenjoyable to learn, and this man is still fighting with his ego. Would recommend to take Beck Hasti lecture as he is nicer, and a better teacher overall.

I had Scott as my lecturer this semester for CS240. Stopped going after the first month and switched to Beck Hasti's lectures. Far, far better and well taught. Note that Beck is the professor for this class and he did a very good job. Just wouldn't recommend going to Scott's lectures if you want to get a clear understanding of the material.
Trash

I'll be blunt, his class is poorly designed to instruct students through a software engineering career. First, his lectures are mandatory and a waste of time. Second, he doesn't even discuss the readings. Finally, the final is unnecessarily long. There is too much writing involved in the process and so many questions to answer. UNREASONABLE.

- Huge passion for software engineering. Very opinionated on lots of things-makes it all the more engaging
- Clearly teaches material in meaningful way
- Utilizes past semesters of feedback to make best possible experience for current students
- Open to feedback and will give detailed explanations for any questions asked
- Great sense of humor too!
hilarious...ly bad

Class is poorly organized. 
There are so many different grading schemes and they are all so complicated and make no sense. 
Scott is rude. If you ask him questions (which you will definitely have a lot of), expect a passive aggressive response that does not address your question. 
AVOID AT ALL COSTS FOR YOUR OWN SANITY.

I've never posted a review before but experiencing Swanson made me feel like it's a human right to warn others. DO NOT I repeat DO NOT take his classes if you want to feel sane. His lectures are filled with the most useless stories that he thinks are funny and he is VERY PASSIVE AGGRESSIVE when you ask questions. HE IS SO MEAN FOR NO REASON.
A poorly organized class and professor that fails to effectively teach anything :/
no
Hard professor, get ready to read.

You get out what you put in. His lectures and the class are pretty unorganized, but the point of the class is to simulate being a SWE and figuring things out yourself. He won't force you to learn so you can coast if you want, or bc he and the TA's are VERY knowledgeable, you can learn a ton. If you have a bit of independence this class is great
Worst cs professor in existence. Didn't put grades in at all until a couple days before the final. Easy class though, I just don't think it's worth your sanity.

Worst CS class I've ever taken during four years at UW-Madison.
EXTREMELY unorganized course structure. TAs were clueless to respond to questions.
The contents were extremely easy. 

The trick to earn a score above 100%?

Lie about numbers on how many hours of effort you put into the report and you will get an A+.

If you don't? Good luck!
If I could give him a zero I would.

The content being taught isn't difficult. I'm not sure if this is a newer course that he is teaching and that's why things seemed disorganized but overall it really isn't a hard class. It definitely could be a lot better but it isn't as bad as the others make it seem. I barely tried and got a B.

Horrible. This class has no grading scheme. Up until and including the day of the final, we did not know what our final grade standing was. The TA told me I was doing very well in the class and I still ended up with a B? HOW?? Avoid at all costs. Both the professor and the class are horrible.

Life is hard in CS, Scott makes it even harder. I always hated going to his class but I had to. He'll put deadline in morning and expect us to work by evening. His long rants about his own philosophy makes me cry!

if you have scholastic anxiety, maybe not the best class/prof for you. If you want to work in an agile team on a software project, take this class. Scott is very smart, entertaining, and caring. He can be disorganized, but he will only get better as he teaches this class more. Very easy A if you simply show up to class and dont ghost your teammates

Absolute mess. Scott will give a 10hr lecture on Jimmy Page but wont use Canvas.Understand this class is different & he makes it chill. But all 75min lectures could be 20min vids. Grading system is so "innovative" that no student knows their grades even a week from final. It will probably get better, but avoid it for at least another 2 years
just no. I don't have the ability to speak into existence just how much Scott is the worst professor in the entire world. Avoid at all costs if you value your sanity.
I would rather drop out of school than take his class again.

How this man ever received a teaching job, let alone at this college is beyond my comprehension. Most disorganized person I have ever met. Very nice though if you ever have the displeasure of speaking with him though.

My experience with Professor Swanson was truly disappointing. This class can be summarized by disorganization, poor communication, and a lack of responsibility. I sincerely hope that this review helps future students avoid taking this class.
so bad he inspired me to write a review
Bad

Do not even consider taking CS 506 with Scott Swanson. It's week 6 and we still haven't started on our semester long projects that this class is meant for. I'm in class right now and he wasted the first 30 minutes making excuses for why he can't organize this class. He still has not proved that he knows anything about software engineering

I've had some terrible professors throughout my time at UW-Madison, but Scott is the first to inspire me to write a review here. Extraordinarily and pointedly condescending, and prefers to philosophize in class instead of covering materials. Onus will be entirely on the student to learn any semblance of software development. Avoid at all costs.

Actually the worst professor I've had at UW Madison. Like many others have said, Scott is entitled and condescending, going on completely pointless rants every day. Instead of taking responsibility for his mistakes, he blames students. It is now 2 weeks until spring break and we haven't started our projects (the main purpose of this class).

He has to manage 250 students, and organize them into teams (which is tough)

HOWEVER, this does not excuse his
- disrespectful behavior 
- long, unorganized canvas and piazza posts
- Inability to follow the required textbooks during lecture and instead lecture on his own "philosophical material" 
- blame students for bad polling techniques

Scott is great at talking. So much so that he goes on endless rants regarding information that is not relevant to the course. If you can take a different class in place of 506 I would highly recommend. I thought it was funny at first but I am sitting in class right now and starting to get very frustrated with how bad of a teacher he is.

He is more like a politician rather than a professor since what all he talks in the class is quite useless and unnecessarily vague. He tries to make the class fun and sometimes throws some nice jokes. However, his profession as a professor is the worst among all the professors I have ever met before.

Very easy class, weekly reading quizzes and a big semester long group project, along with some short assignments. Final exam is extremely easy as well because it's all survey type questions about the group project you worked on so no studying/memorization required.
This course is must for students interesting in learning about the software engineering.

Scott Swanson is one of the most irritating people I've ever interacted with. He is completely disrespectful to students, their time, and is often pretentious and condescending. He goes on tangents for entire class periods that have nothing to do with course content. Disorganized class. Worst lectures I've ever had. His class ruins my day.

The semester is almost over and no one knows how they are going to be graded. Lectures and class structure are a mess he is far from understanding and loves to point fingers at everyone else. A very incoherent structure, that is very stressful and anxiety inducing. Everything is self taught could have just been an online class.
Extremely bad class! Classes have zero knowledge and still, it is mandatory. No structure, no rubrics for most assignments.

Professor Swanson is extremely chatty and long-winded. He rambles on about random topics and personal beliefs, rarely staying on topic. He's also quite whiny and neurotic, and is the only professor I've had in 4 years of college whose personality has truly bothered me. Going to his class is draining and upsetting. The class is really easy though.

Expects students to check Piazza in the morning and at night. There really is no class structure. You can go to lecture if you want to listen to him talk about his past and his favorite painting. He will assign homework due in less than 24 hours since he assigned it. Rating at bottom = FAKE. Not a single true statement in there. Avoid this guy

The organization of this class is a mess. There are confusions everywhere. 
1. Lecture: Zero information, random. Talk about his fav painting for 30 min
2. Syllabus: Until the mid of the semester, he finally publishes the syllabus on canvas
3. Canvas: Having constant issue creating assignment and keep making mistakes. 5-8 emails+announcement / day

If you have any other options, take them instead. Loves to stroke his own ego and talk about how smart he is, will spend classes berating students for not reading every single Piazza post. Will have due dates of less than 24 hours and then be offended if anyone pushes back. One of the most poorly run classes I have ever taken.

Avoid him at all cost. Literally teaching nothing in class. If you are seeking any software engineering experience, go with CS 639 instead. This man, this legend, once said students should check piazza and canvas once they wake up and before going to sleep (how come is that a mandatory thing?

The man, the myth, the legend: Emdad. This man single-handly allowed me to sky rocket my grades, while reducing my anxiety. This man is a saint. He will never yell at you and will hold your hand with even the most basic assignments. Please show him love and respect.
